channel.description: Welcome to the Single Again! Now What? item.title: 10 Things to Do and Not Do During The Holidays after Divorce! - Dec 07,2010
item.description:
Join Joanie and her new co-host, Mike Mastracci for a very special show.--- During and after divorce is an emotional roller coaster ride... especially during the holidays. Joanie and Mike will be sharing 10 things to do and not to do during the holidays to help you enjoy more ease, less stress and have a lot more fun.

item.description:

item.title: Divorce and Dating: Avoiding Parenting Pitfalls When Children are Exposed to your New Relationships - Oct 27,2010
item.description:
Mike Mastracci is a nationally recognized family law attorney, from Baltimore, Maryland with over 20 years of professional experience.--- He is a Collaborative Divorce Attorney, mediator and Child Access Coach.--- After surviving his own gut-wrenching divorce and child custody battle, Mastracci founded and operated Maryland’s first full-service Child Access Center.--- The Child Access Center is a child friendly resource center dedicated to protecting the rights of children and parent-child relationships and the center was a liaison to courts in several jurisdictions.

item.title: Relationships don’t have to be hard… they just have to be bringing the sacred back to sex. - Oct 20,2010
item.description:
Special guest... Maryanne Comaroto has developed a relationship training program called the Certificate of Responsible Relationship (CORR).--- In addition to being California State certified as continuing education, CORRR is a program for people who want to find out what's holding them back in attracting or sustaining a relationship; for people who have painful baggage; for people who are done looking for one-night stands; for people who want to get more than a couple decent dates.--- She hinges her teachings on the idea that sparked her own personal transformation: Great relationships begin within!

item.title: Overwhelmed: The Life of a Single Mom - Oct 06,2010
item.description:
When Jennifer Barnes Maggio sat down to write her new book for single moms, she asked herself, “What is the one feeling that keeps surfacing, as a single parent?” The answer was easy - OVERWHELMED!--- Whether it is the stress of finances or parenting children alone, the single parent often feels stressed, burdened, and ultimately overwhelmed.

item.title: Winning After Divorce - Sep 29,2010
item.description:
Special guest, Len Stauffenger, author of "Getting Over It".---This is NOT a book by a PhD written about 'theory'. This is from a man who has been through raising children on his own.--- In other words he has already been where you are. He will talk about what Really works." If all of my clients of divorce would now read this book, their lives and the lives of their children would be oh so much better." ---Jeannette Lofus, PhD, LCSW President, Stepfamily Foundation

item.title: THE SEVEN BIGGEST MYTHS ABOUT DIVORCE - Sep 22,2010
item.description:
Mark Greeene, a Family Law Attorney shares the seven (7) biggest myths about divorce in Massachusett.---Even if you do not live in MA, understanding the myths may help.---How much do you know about family law in Massachusetts? You may have some familiarity with divorce, spousal support and child custody issues from watching family or friends go through divorces or from tidbits you’re gleaned from the Internet.---If you’re like most people, however, what you think you know may be wrong.

item.title: Patty Hansen, the ex of Mark Victor Hansen talks about Divorce and Recovery - Sep 15,2010
item.description:
Writing Chicken Soup for the Soul Divorce and Recovery was not only inspirational to Patty Hansen...it was personal!----- FOR YOU SEE... Patty was the business partner as well as wife for 27 years to her coauthor, writer/motivational speaker Mark Victor Hansen. During those 27 years they worked together, played together, raised a family together and built the Chicken Soup for the Soul empire.----- But sadly, like almost 50% of marriages in America today their marriage failed.----- But here's the difference... and it's a big difference...Patty and Mark work together to ensure that they have a successful "good" divorce.-----Patty says "it takes patience, and believing in what's really important, in order to move forward and not get caught up in the shock, logistics and pain of divorce..

item.title: Online Dating Pro's and Con's. - Sep 01,2010
item.description:
My guest today Jonathon Aslay Relationship Confidant is a Romance and Relationship Matchmaker for Women.--- After turning 40 and going through a divorce in 2005, Jonathon began internet dating with the hopes of beginning the second chapter of his life with someone new. What he didn't expect was the dating and almost 10,000 hours of conversations listening to women share their relationship stories would change his life.--- Jonathon shares the mind of a single/divorced man to women and to help them answer the questions that baffled them most when it comes to dating and being in a relationship with men over 40.

item.title: Meet Toby...The Miracle Dog! - Aug 18,2010
item.description:
On Toby's Term's is a captivating story of a dog that teaches his owners that, despite their best efforts to make him into the dog they want him to be, he is the one that lays out the terms of being the dog he needs to be.--- Toby goes from incorrigible to incredible and in the process teaches his owners important life lessons about patience, purpose and unconditional love.--- Charmaine Hammond will speak to your audience about her incredible journey she has taken with Toby.--- She will talk about the lessons she has learned from this amazing pet and teach your listeners how they can apply these lessons to their lives no matter what hardships they have suffered.--- Get ready for the miracle that is Toby!

item.title: Relationship Recovery: DUMP THE JUMP and GET WHAT YOU WANT! - Aug 04,2010
item.description:
Joe Rumbolo is a Transformational Life Empowerment Coach Certified In Spiritual Psychology, Seminar Author and Facilitator and Radio Talk Show Host who specializes in Personal Growth and Development and Relationship Recovery.--- Within the area of Relationship Coaching and Recovery, he works with clients using his DUMP THE JUMP and GET WHAT YOU WANT Process.--- Among other things, this process provides the information, principles, tools and mechanics for people to detach from relationships, surrender and release negative feelings and emotions and to forgive themselves and others, in a healthy way, to allow them to begin moving their lives in a forward direction.

item.description:

item.title: How Do You Go From a Zookeeper to a Girly Web Geek ? - Jun 23,2010
item.description:
Join our special guest, Lara Kulpa.--- Lara has been a plus size model, photographer for a volunteer fire department, personal trainer, lab technician for a biotech company, zookeeper, and retired racing greyhound rescuer.--- Finally, she's found her true calling, in her thirties no less! Though she knows that animals will always play an integral part in her life, Lara truly enjoys helping people find their place on the web, and helping them to develop and grow their businesses online.

item.title: ALONE? BROKE? ILL? AND HOW TO BUILD A HOUSE... - May 05,2010
item.description:
Scott Stevenson shows you why you might choose these challenges in his new inspirational memoir, LOOKS EASY ENOUGH, A Joyful Memoir of Overcoming Disease, Divorce and Disaster.

item.title: Support for Stepfamilies During the Holidays - Dec 14,2009
item.description:
Special guest: Jacquelyn Fletcher, a stepfamily coach.--- There are few times of year as emotionally loaded as the holidays. For many stepfamilies the stress of figuring out how to navigate the traditions of each faction—his kids, her kids, our kids—can be exhausting and painful.--- Whether the kids are ages 5 or 50, conflict can arise about where to spend the holidays, whose rituals to follow, and who “counts” as a member of the family.

item.title: Getting to Know the Other Side - A Conversation with a Single Dad - Aug 26,2009
item.description:
Guest-Barry Kahan founder of SingleDadLife.com , which is fast becoming recognized as one of the leading websites in its category. He was certain of one thing. He did not want his website to be about whining or complaining about your ex or how difficult life is as a single dad. Instead, Single Dad Life was created for men who believe designing their best life is about being an awesome dad and living their life full out! Single Dads, who for lack of a better term, maintain their “mojo” for life.

item.title: Knowing the Difference Between Normal Stress vs. Anxiety - Mar 31,2009
item.description:
Guest: Karen Muranko---As someone who has been in recovery from Panic Disorder since June 2002 after living with the disorder for thirty years, I work to inspire others to know that mental health and wellness is achievable.--- All of us from time to time experience "normal" stress. The stress of starting a new job, moving to a new location or going through a divorce. It's important to pay attention to whatever is causing you stress and when it starts to escalate to anxiety.---Learn the signs to be aware of when stress is beginning to transition into anxiety.

item.title: “Soul Mates - Truth or a Dangerous Myth?” - Feb 18,2009
item.description:
Special Guest- Patrick Wanis, Ph.D. Are you tired of failed relationships? Do soul mates even exist? Can someone else make you happy and complete you? Is your soul mate perfect? How will you find and attract him or her? Is it too late? Is your partner your soul mate?---Whether we consciously recognize it or not, our deepest desire is to love and be loved. Love nourishes the heart, mind, body and soul. It is love that awakens all of our senses and gives us the feeling of being complete. Thus, many of us spend most of our lives looking for that love that we believe will complete us.--- Some of us become despondent or desperate because we have not yet found that one person that we believe was destined to be with us, the one person who we expect will fill our every need, complete us and make us eternally happy –our soul mate and perfect match.---Patrick Wanis, Ph.D., one of the foremost experts on the mind, human behavior, relationships, sexuality, and personal success, will share his expertise on your relationship with yourself, smash wide open the myth behind soul mates and divulge the missing key and five steps to “Finding Your Ideal Match and Loving Yourself.”

item.title: Speaking About Depression - Jan 14,2009
item.description:
Guests- Patricia Gallaghers and her daughter, Katelyn--- The Gallaghers know what happy times look like - they lived in a great neighborhood, a comfortable home, they had a happy marriage, and four beautiful children.--- But when their family was ravaged by depression, they didn't know where to turn, or how to cope. Many lessons were learned the hard way. ---They have written a book as a family, to help others deal with difficult situations: NO MORE SECRETS –A FAMILY SPEAKS ABOUT DEPRESSION, ANXIETY AND ATTEMPTED SUICIDE is the title of the book which is a compelling narrative of a family shattered by attempted suicide. *** Patricia Gallagher is the author of five books and has appeared on Oprah, Sally Jessy Raphael, QVC, CNN, the 700 Club, (all two times) and the CBS Early Show, CNBC, FNN and hundreds of other shows. Articles have been written about Patricia Gallagher in Family Circle, Parents, Woman’s World magazines, and UPI, Associated Press and Gannett Wire Services.
